TopicTitle: How to get to the mun and back (SIMPLE TUTORIAL) Not Completed Yet!

Articles.Content:
This is basically answering "how do i get to the mun and back?"questions.

First step: Delta-V Calculating

For beginners,delta-v means the "amount of thrust required to get to a body" in this case.

Here we have a delta V map here:

This may look complicated,but its pretty easy. On the bottom right you can see what the numbers in given areas mean.

It says for kerbin you need 4500 dV for a stable orbit. It requires 860 dV for an intercept,and 210 dV for orbit.

Lets do the math. So 4500 + 860 = 5360 dV for the orbit and encounter.

5360 + 210 = 5570 + 640 = 6210 is the required amount for this.

(NOTE: Delta V may vary depending on how much thrust you use. This only shows the minimum amount for orbit,so you may want to bring more on the ride.)

Good Delta V calculators can be Mechjeb or Kerbal Engineer.
